creator: petr.kuzel@sun.com
text:
create catalog like this (/etc/sgml/catalog):

CATALOG /usr/share/sgml/sgml-iso-entities-8879.1986/catalog
CATALOG /usr/share/sgml/docbook/xml-dtd-4.1.2/catalog

resolver use only the first catalog.

There was a bug (though I hadn't encountered it before) in the construction of
file: URLs that might have been related, but I couldn't reproduce your
experience (only loading the first of serveral subsidiary catalogs).

Can you test your setup with the org.apache.xml.resolver.apps.xread application,
setting debug to something large like 10, and send me the resulst?
creator: apache-bugzilla@nwalsh.com

text:
I cannot reproduce it. Marking as works-for-me until a reproduction case will be
constructed.

java -cp build/resolver.jar org.apache.xml.resolver.apps.xparse -c catalogs -d
10 catalog.xml

Cannot find CatalogManager.properties
Cannot find CatalogManager.properties
Cannot find CatalogManager.properties
Cannot find CatalogManager.properties
Parse catalog: ./xcatalog

Default BASE: file:/data/cvs/apache/xml-commons/java/xcatalog

Cannot find CatalogManager.properties

creator: petr.kuzel@sun.com

text:
CatalogManager.properties is a property file that can be used to specify a
number of resolver defaults. It's described in the documentation, which I just
realized isn't in the project.

I'll add the documentation and my tests to the project.
creator: apache-bugzilla@nwalsh.com

text:
Besides, am I right that Ant developers created for their 1.5 its own catalog
format (e.g. for style task) instead of utilizing this project?
creator: petr.kuzel@sun.com

text: Oh, *sigh*. Did they? I don't know, I haven't looked.
creator: apache-bugzilla@nwalsh.com
petr.kuzel@sun.com
text:
Created attachment 2087
Diff allowing to have several customized instances in one JVM

Re. Ant - no, they call into resolver.jar via reflection if it is available.

http://cvs.apache.org/viewcvs/ant/src/main/org/apache/tools/ant/types/XMLCatalog.java?rev=1.24&content-type=text/vnd.viewcvs-markup

Re. the attached diff - does it still apply? Should it be filed in this issue?
If so shouldn't this issue be reopened until it is applied?
creator: jesse.glick@netbeans.com

text:
I think this bug can be closed. The outstanding patch has been made obsolete by
the refactoring that I did to allow for multiple CatalogManager()s.
creator: apache-bugzilla@nwalsh.com
